reasoning: Ventricular arrhythmias are abnormal electrical rhythms originating in the ventricles. Incidence varies by population and type (premature ventricular contractions are common, sustained ventricular tachycardia is rarer). Estimated at 2-3 per 100k per year for clinically significant arrhythmias requiring treatment. Confidence moderate due to heterogeneous subtypes and population-dependent variation.
